  16. (* Definition of a few built-in actions *)

  18. open Ocamltest_stdlib
  19. open Actions

  21. ‌let reason_with_fallback env fallback =
  22.   match Environments.lookup Builtin_variables.reason env with
  23.   | None -> fallback
  24.   | Some reason -> reason

  26. ‌let pass = make
  27.   ~name:"pass"
  28.   ~description:"Always succeed"
  29.   (fun _log env ->
  30.     let reason = reason_with_fallback env "the pass action always succeeds" in
  31.     let result = Result.pass_with_reason reason in
  32.     (result, env))

  34. let skip = make
  35.   ~name:"skip"
  36.   ~description:"Always skip the test"
  37.   (fun _log env ->
  38.     let reason = reason_with_fallback env "the skip action always skips" in
  39.     let result = Result.skip_with_reason reason in
  40.     (result, env))

  42. let fail = make
  43.   ~name:"fail"
  44.   ~description:"Always fail"
  45.   (fun _log env ->
  46.     let reason = reason_with_fallback env "the fail action always fails" in
  47.     let result = Result.fail_with_reason reason in
  48.     (result, env))

  50. let cd = make
  51.   ~name:"cd"
  52.   ~description:"Change working directory"
  53.   (fun _log env ->
  54.     let cwd = Environments.safe_lookup Builtin_variables.cwd env in
  55.     begin
  56.       try
  57.         Sys.chdir cwd; (Result.pass, env)
  58.       with _ ->
  59.         let reason = "Could not chidir to \"" ^ cwd ^ "\"" in
  60.         let result = Result.fail_with_reason reason in
  61.         (result, env)
  62.     end)

  64. let dumpenv = make
  65.   ~name:"dumpenv"
  66.   ~description:"Dump the environment"
  67.   (fun log env ->
  68.     Environments.dump log env; (Result.pass, env))

  70. let hasunix = make
  71.   ~name:"hasunix"
  72.   ~description:"Pass if the unix library is available"
  73.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip (Ocamltest_config.libunix <> None)
  74.     "unix library available"
  75.     "unix library not available")

  77. let libunix = make
  78.   ~name:"libunix"
  79.   ~description:"Pass if libunix is available"
  80.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip (Ocamltest_config.libunix = Some true)
  81.     "libunix available"
  82.     "libunix not available")

  84. let libwin32unix = make
  85.   ~name:"libwin32unix"
  86.   ~description:"Pass if the win32 variant of the unix library is available"
  87.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip (Ocamltest_config.libunix = Some false)
  88.     "win32 variant of the unix library available"
  89.     "win32 variant of the unix library not available")

  91. let hassysthreads = make
  92.   ~name:"hassysthreads"
  93.   ~description:"Pass if the systhreads library is available"
  94.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip Ocamltest_config.systhreads
  95.     "systhreads library available"
  96.     "systhreads library not available")

  98. let hasstr = make
  99.   ~name:"hasstr"
  100.   ~description:"Pass if the str library is available"
  101.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip Ocamltest_config.str
  102.     "str library available"
  103.     "str library not available")

  105. let windows_OS = "Windows_NT"

  107. let get_OS () = Sys.safe_getenv "OS"

  109. let windows = make
  110.   ~name:"windows"
  111.   ~description:"Pass if running on Windows"
  112.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip (get_OS () = windows_OS)
  113.     "running on Windows"
  114.     "not running on Windows")

  116. let not_windows = make
  117.   ~name:"not-windows"
  118.   ~description:"Pass if not running on Windows"
  119.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip (get_OS () <> windows_OS)
  120.     "not running on Windows"
  121.     "running on Windows")

  123. let is_bsd_system s =
  124.   match s with
  125.   | "bsd_elf" | "netbsd" | "freebsd" | "openbsd" -> true
  126.   | _ -> false

  128. ‌let bsd = make
  129.   ~name:"bsd"
  130.   ~description:"Pass if running on a BSD system"
  131.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip (is_bsd_system Ocamltest_config.system)
  132.     "on a BSD system"
  133.     "not on a BSD system")

  135. ‌let not_bsd = make
  136.   ~name:"not-bsd"
  137.   ~description:"Pass if not running on a BSD system"
  138.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip (not (is_bsd_system Ocamltest_config.system))
  139.     "not on a BSD system"
  140.     "on a BSD system")

  142. ‌let macos_system = "macosx"

  144. ‌let macos = make
  145.   ~name:"macos"
  146.   ~description:"Pass if running on a MacOS system"
  147.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip (Ocamltest_config.system = macos_system)
  148.     "on a MacOS system"
  149.     "not on a MacOS system")

  151. ‌let arch32 = make
  152.   ~name:"arch32"
  153.   ~description:"Pass if running on a 32-bit architecture"
  154.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip (Sys.word_size = 32)
  155.     "32-bit architecture"
  156.     "non-32-bit architecture")

  158. ‌let arch64 = make
  159.   ~name:"arch64"
  160.   ~description:"Pass if running on a 64-bit architecture"
  161.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip (Sys.word_size = 64)
  162.     "64-bit architecture"
  163.     "non-64-bit architecture")

  165. ‌let arch_arm = make
  166.   ~name:"arch_arm"
  167.   ~description:"Pass if target is an ARM architecture"
  168.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip (String.equal Ocamltest_config.arch "arm")
  169.      "Target is ARM architecture"
  170.      "Target is not ARM architecture")

  172. ‌let arch_arm64 = make
  173.   ~name:"arch_arm64"
  174.   ~description:"Pass if target is an ARM64 architecture"
  175.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip (String.equal Ocamltest_config.arch "arm64")
  176.      "Target is ARM64 architecture"
  177.      "Target is not ARM64 architecture")

  183.      "Target is AMD64 architecture"
  184.      "Target is not AMD64 architecture")

  204.      "Target supports function sections"
  205.      "Target does not support function sections")

  211.      "frame-pointers available"
  212.      "frame-pointers not available")

  214. ‌let has_symlink = make
  215.   ~name:"has_symlink"
  216.   ~description:"Pass if symbolic links are available"
  217.   (Actions_helpers.pass_or_skip (Unix.has_symlink () )
  218.     "symlinks available"
  219.     "symlinks not available")

  221. ‌let setup_build_env = make
  222.   ~name:"setup-build-env"
  223.   ~description:"Create a dedicated directory for the test and populates it"
  224.   (Actions_helpers.setup_build_env true [])

  226. ‌let setup_simple_build_env = make
  227.   ~name:"setup-simple-build-env"
  228.   ~description:"Do not create a dedicated directory, but only sets the \
  229.     test_build_directory variable"
  230.   (Actions_helpers.setup_simple_build_env true [])

  232. ‌let run = make
  233.   ~name:"run"
  234.   ~description:"Run the program"
  235.   Actions_helpers.run_program

  237. ‌let script = make
  238.   ~name:"script"
  239.   ~description:"Run the script specified by the script variable"
  240.   Actions_helpers.run_script

  242. ‌let check_program_output = make
  243.   ~name:"check-program-output"
  244.   ~description:"Compare the output of the program with its reference"
  245.   (Actions_helpers.check_output "program"
  246.     Builtin_variables.output
  247.     Builtin_variables.reference)

  249. ‌let file_exists_action _log env =
  250.   match Environments.lookup Builtin_variables.file env with
  251.     | None ->
  252.       let reason = reason_with_fallback env "the file variable is undefined" in
  253.       let result = Result.fail_with_reason reason in
  254.       (result, env)
  255.     | Some filename ->
  256.       if Sys.file_exists filename
  257.       then begin
  258.         let default_reason = Printf.sprintf "File %s exists" filename in
  259.         let reason = reason_with_fallback env default_reason in
  260.         let result = Result.pass_with_reason reason in
  261.         (result, env)
  262.       end else begin
  263.         let default_reason =
  264.           Printf.sprintf "File %s does not exist" filename
  265.         in
  266.         let reason = reason_with_fallback env default_reason in
  267.         let result = Result.fail_with_reason reason in
  268.         (result, env)
  269.       end
  270. let file_exists = make
  271.   ~name:"file-exists"
  272.   ~description:"Pass if there is a file at the path contained in variable \
  273.     `file`"
  274.   file_exists_action

  276. ‌let copy_action log env =
  277.   let do_copy src dst =
  278.     let (entry_type, f) =
  279.       if Sys.is_directory src
  280.       then ("directory", Sys.copy_directory)
  281.       else ("file", Sys.copy_file)
  282.     in
  283.     Printf.fprintf log "Copying %s %s to %s\n%!" entry_type src dst;
  284.     f src dst
  285.   in
  286. ‌  let src = Environments.lookup Builtin_variables.src env in
  287. ‌  let dst = Environments.lookup Builtin_variables.dst env in
  288.   match (src, dst) with
  289.     | (None, _) | (_, None) ->
  290. ‌      let reason = reason_with_fallback env "src or dst are undefined" in
  291. ‌      let result = Result.fail_with_reason reason in
  292.       (result, env)
  293.     | (Some src, Some dst) ->
  294. ‌      let f =
  295.         if String.ends_with ~suffix:"/" dst
  296.         then fun src -> do_copy src (dst ^ (Filename.basename src))
  297.         else fun src -> do_copy src dst
  298.       in
  299.       List.iter f (String.words src);
  300.       (Result.pass, env)

  302. ‌let copy = make ~name:"copy" ~description:"Copy a file" copy_action

  304. ‌let initialize_test_exit_status_variables _log env =
  305.   Environments.add_bindings
  306.   [
  307.     Builtin_variables.test_pass, "0";
  308.     Builtin_variables.test_fail, "1";
  309.     Builtin_variables.test_skip, "125";
  310.   ] env

  312. let _ =
  313.   Environments.register_initializer Environments.Post
  314.     "test_exit_status_variables" initialize_test_exit_status_variables;
  315.   List.iter register
  316.   [
  317.     pass;
  318.     skip;
  319.     fail;
  320.     cd;
  321.     dumpenv;
  322.     hasunix;
  323.     hassysthreads;
  324.     hasstr;
  325.     libunix;
  326.     libwin32unix;

  328.     not_windows;
  329.     bsd;
  330.     not_bsd;
  331.     macos;
  332.     arch32;
  333.     arch64;
  334.     has_symlink;

  336.     setup_simple_build_env;
  337.     run;
  338.     script;
  339.     check_program_output;

  342.     arch_amd64;

  349.   ]
